de.schlegel11.jfxanimation

Interface JFXTemplateProcess<N>

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    JFXTemplateAction<N>, JFXTemplateConfig<N>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    JFXAnimationTemplate

    public interface JFXTemplateProcess<N>
    Class which provides methods for the animation process.
    This action is comparable to a KeyFrame and represents a CSS like percentage definition (for a specific part) in keyframe animations.
    Since:
    2018-10-04
    Author:
    Marcel Schlegel (schlegel11)

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      JFXTemplateAction<N> from()
      Defines a percentage value of 0 in the specific animation interval.
      JFXTemplateAction<N> percent(double percent, double... percents)
      Takes a percentage value or percentage values between 0 and 100 which defines the specific animation interval.
      JFXTemplateAction<N> time(Duration time, Duration... times)
      Takes a Duration value or Duration values which defines the specific animation interval.
      JFXTemplateAction<N> to()
      Defines a percentage value of 100 in the specific animation interval.

    • Method Detail

      • percent

        JFXTemplateAction<N> percent(double percent,
                             double... percents)
        Takes a percentage value or percentage values between 0 and 100 which defines the specific animation interval.
        If the value is smaller than 0 or bigger than 100 it will be ignored.
        Be careful with edge cases e.g. if the percentage value is a result of a calculation like 100 / 1.
        The result might not be exact e.g. 100.0001.
        Parameters:
        percent - the percentage value.
        percents - the percentage values.
        Returns:
        A JFXTemplateAction instance.

      • from

        JFXTemplateAction<N> from()
        Defines a percentage value of 0 in the specific animation interval.
        Returns:
        A JFXTemplateAction instance.

      • to

        JFXTemplateAction<N> to()
        Defines a percentage value of 100 in the specific animation interval.
        Returns:
        A JFXTemplateAction instance.

      • time

        JFXTemplateAction<N> time(Duration time,
                          Duration... times)
        Takes a Duration value or Duration values which defines the specific animation interval.
        The Duration values are independent from a configured JFXAnimationTemplateConfig.Builder.duration(Duration).
        That means if a defined Duration value is greater than a configured JFXAnimationTemplateConfig.Builder.duration(Duration) value, the animation will take longer.
        If there are no percent(double, double...) definitions, a configured JFXAnimationTemplateConfig.Builder.duration(Duration) isn't necessary.
        Parameters:
        time - the Duration value.
        times - the Duration values.
        Returns:
        A JFXTemplateAction instance.
